segment.source: title: Track recently used files and folders
segment.target: title: Track recently used files and folders

segment.source: description: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).
segment.target: description: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).

segment.source: Track recently used files and folders
segment.target: Track recently used files and folders

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: ** Important APIs **
segment.target: ** Important APIs **

segment.source: MostRecentlyUsedList
segment.target: MostRecentlyUsedList

segment.source: FileOpenPicker
segment.target: FileOpenPicker

segment.source: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).
segment.target: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).

segment.source: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.
segment.target: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.

segment.source: All apps have their own MRU.
segment.target: All apps have their own MRU.

segment.source: Your app's MRU is represented by the StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList class, which you obtain from the static StorageApplicationPermissions.MostRecentlyUsedList property.
segment.target: Your app's MRU is represented by the StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList class, which you obtain from the static StorageApplicationPermissions.MostRecentlyUsedList property.

segment.source: MRU items are stored as IStorageItem objects, so both StorageFile objects (which represent files) and StorageFolder objects (which represent folders) can be added to the MRU.
segment.target: MRU items are stored as IStorageItem objects, so both StorageFile objects (which represent files) and StorageFolder objects (which represent folders) can be added to the MRU.

segment.source: Note Also see the File picker sample and the File access sample.
segment.target: Note Also see the File picker sample and the File access sample.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

segment.source: Access permissions to the location
segment.target: Access permissions to the location

segment.source: See File access permissions.
segment.target: See File access permissions.

segment.source: Open files and folders with a picker
segment.target: Open files and folders with a picker

segment.source: Picked files are often the same files that users return to again and again.
segment.target: Picked files are often the same files that users return to again and again.

segment.source: Add a picked file to the MRU
segment.target: Add a picked file to the MRU

segment.source: The files that your user picks are often files that they return to repeatedly.
segment.target: The files that your user picks are often files that they return to repeatedly.

segment.source: So consider adding picked files to your app's MRU as soon as they are picked.
segment.target: So consider adding picked files to your app's MRU as soon as they are picked.

segment.source: Here's how.
segment.target: Here's how.

segment.source: StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList.Add is overloaded.
segment.target: StorageItemMostRecentlyUsedList.Add is overloaded.

segment.source: In the example, we use Add(IStorageItem, String) so that we can associate metadata with the file.
segment.target: In the example, we use Add(IStorageItem, String) so that we can associate metadata with the file.

segment.source: Setting metadata lets you record the item's purpose, for example "profile pic".
segment.target: Setting metadata lets you record the item's purpose, for example "profile pic".

segment.source: You can also add the file to the MRU without metadata by calling Add(IStorageItem).
segment.target: You can also add the file to the MRU without metadata by calling Add(IStorageItem).

segment.source: When you add an item to the MRU, the method returns a uniquely identifying string, called a token, which is used to retrieve the item.
segment.target: When you add an item to the MRU, the method returns a uniquely identifying string, called a token, which is used to retrieve the item.

segment.source: Tip You'll need the token to retrieve an item from the MRU, so persist it somewhere.
segment.target: Tip You'll need the token to retrieve an item from the MRU, so persist it somewhere.

segment.source: For more info about app data, see Managing application data.
segment.target: For more info about app data, see Managing application data.

segment.source: Use a token to retrieve an item from the MRU
segment.target: Use a token to retrieve an item from the MRU

segment.source: Use the retrieval method most appropriate for the item you want to retrieve.
segment.target: Use the retrieval method most appropriate for the item you want to retrieve.

segment.source: Retrieve a file as a StorageFile by using GetFileAsync.
segment.target: Retrieve a file as a StorageFile by using GetFileAsync.

segment.source: Retrieve a folder as a StorageFolder by using GetFolderAsync.
segment.target: Retrieve a folder as a StorageFolder by using GetFolderAsync.

segment.source: Retrieve a generic IStorageItem, which can represent either a file or folder, by using GetItemAsync.
segment.target: Retrieve a generic IStorageItem, which can represent either a file or folder, by using GetItemAsync.

segment.source: Here's how to get back the file we just added.
segment.target: Here's how to get back the file we just added.

segment.source: Here's how to iterate all the entries to get tokens and then items.
segment.target: Here's how to iterate all the entries to get tokens and then items.

segment.source: The AccessListEntryView lets you iterate entries in the MRU.
segment.target: The AccessListEntryView lets you iterate entries in the MRU.

segment.source: These entries are AccessListEntry structures that contain the token and metadata for an item.
segment.target: These entries are AccessListEntry structures that contain the token and metadata for an item.

segment.source: Removing items from the MRU when it's full
segment.target: Removing items from the MRU when it's full

segment.source: When the MRU's 25-item limit is reached and you try to add a new item, the item that was accessed the longest time ago is automatically removed.
segment.target: When the MRU's 25-item limit is reached and you try to add a new item, the item that was accessed the longest time ago is automatically removed.

segment.source: So, you never need to remove an item before you add a new one.
segment.target: So, you never need to remove an item before you add a new one.

segment.source: Future-access list
segment.target: Future-access list

segment.source: As well as an MRU, your app also has a future-access list.
segment.target: As well as an MRU, your app also has a future-access list.

segment.source: By picking files and folders, your user grants your app permission to access items that might not be accessible otherwise.
segment.target: By picking files and folders, your user grants your app permission to access items that might not be accessible otherwise.

segment.source: If you add these items to your future-access list then you'll retain that permission when your app wants to access those items again later.
segment.target: If you add these items to your future-access list then you'll retain that permission when your app wants to access those items again later.

segment.source: Your app's future-access list is represented by the StorageItemAccessList class, which you obtain from the static StorageApplicationPermissions.FutureAccessList property.
segment.target: Your app's future-access list is represented by the StorageItemAccessList class, which you obtain from the static StorageApplicationPermissions.FutureAccessList property.

segment.source: When a user picks an item, consider adding it to your future-access list as well as your MRU.
segment.target: When a user picks an item, consider adding it to your future-access list as well as your MRU.

segment.source: The FutureAccessList can hold up to 1000 items.
segment.target: The FutureAccessList can hold up to 1000 items.

segment.source: Remember: it can hold folders as well as files, so that's a lot of folders.
segment.target: Remember: it can hold folders as well as files, so that's a lot of folders.

segment.source: The platform never removes items from the FutureAccessList for you.
segment.target: The platform never removes items from the FutureAccessList for you.

segment.source: When you reach the 1000-item limit, you can't add another until you make room with the Remove method.
segment.target: When you reach the 1000-item limit, you can't add another until you make room with the Remove method.
